Detailed Description

Wifi functions.

You can add a Wifi module into your POB Robotics Suite robot. This module allows you to connect on a wireless network.

You can create 2 servers on the robot and 2 remote connection.

Join a wifi network.
#include <pobRoboticSuite.h>

int main(void)
{
    UInt8   result;
    UInt8   buffer[32];
    UInt32  size;
    WifiConnectionInfo infoConnection;


    // Init cpu and robot :
    InitCpu();
    InitRobot();

    ﻿if( InitWifiHardware() == WIFI_OK)
    {
        // Wifi hardware is initialized, now connect to a wifi network:
        if( JoinWifiNetwork( "MyWifiNetwork",13,"mykey",5,0)==WIFI_OK)
        {
            // Now wifi is connected on the 'MyWifiNetwork', configure ip address by te dhcp server :
            if( SetIpConfiguration(1,0,0,0) == WIFI_OK)
            {
                // Create a simple server on TCP port 8080
                initTCPServer(8080);

                // Create a simple server on UDP port 8080
                initUDPServer(8080);
            }

        }
    }

    // Main loop :
    while(1)
    {
        result = GetBufferFromWifi(buffer,32,&size,&infoConnection);

        if( result == WIFI_OK )
        {
            // buffer stores the data received, size is the data lenght
            // and infoConnection store informations about the connexion.

            // for the example, a ping pong between client and server :

            if( infoConnection.isUdp == 0)
            {
                // We have received a wifi packet on the TCP server : echo back !
                SendBufferToRemoteClient(buffer,size,0,0);
            }
            else
            {
                // We have received a wifi packet on the UDP server : echo back !
                SendBufferToRemoteClient(buffer,size,infoConnection.ip,infoConnection.port);
            }

        }
    }


    return 0;
}
Create a wifi network.
#include <pobRoboticSuite.h>

int main(void)
{
    UInt8   result;
    UInt8   buffer[32];
    UInt32  size;
    WifiConnectionInfo infoConnection;

    UInt8 ip[4];
    UInt8 mask[4];
    UInt8 gateway[4];

    ip[0] = 192;
    ip[1] = 168;
    ip[2] = 1;
    ip[3] = 1;

    mask[0] = 255;
    mask[1] = 255;
    mask[2] = 255;
    mask[3] = 0;

    gateway[0] = 0;
    gateway[1] = 0;
    gateway[2] = 0;
    gateway[3] = 0;


    // Init cpu and robot :
    InitCpu();
    InitRobot();

    ﻿if( InitWifiHardware() == WIFI_OK)
    {
        // Wifi hardware is initialized, now create a wifi network:
        if( CreateWifiNetwork( "pobrobot",8,"mykey",5) == WIFI_OK )
        {
            // Now wifi is created with the name 'pobrobot', configure ip address :
            if( SetIpConfiguration(0,ip,mask,gateway) == WIFI_OK)
            {
                // Create a simple server on TCP port 8080
                initTCPServer(8080);

                // Create a simple server on UDP port 8080
                initUDPServer(8080);
            }

        }
    }

    // Main loop :
    while(1)
    {
        result = GetBufferFromWifi(buffer,32,&size,&infoConnection);

        if( result == WIFI_OK )
        {
            // buffer stores the data received, size is the data lenght
            // and infoConnection store informations about the connexion.

            // for the example, a ping pong between client and server :
            if( infoConnection.isUdp == 0)
            {
                // We have received a wifi packet on the TCP server : echo back !
                SendBufferToRemoteClient(buffer,size,0,0);
            }
            else
            {
                // We have received a wifi packet on the UDP server : echo back !
                SendBufferToRemoteClient(buffer,size,infoConnection.ip,infoConnection.port);
            }

        }
    }


    return 0;
}

Define Documentation

#define WIFI_BUFFER_OVERFLOW   7

A buffer overflow during reception

#define WIFI_CONNECTION_CLOSED   3

Connection closed by remote host

#define WIFI_ERROR   1

Last operation failed

#define WIFI_NO_CLIENT_CONNECTED   4

No client connected

#define WIFI_NO_HARDWARE   5

No wifi hardware detected

#define WIFI_NO_PACKET   2

No packet receveid

#define WIFI_OK   0

Wifi module ok

#define WIFI_TIMEOUT   6

Operation on wifi timeout

UInt32  SSIDLength,

Create a wifi network.

Create a ad-hoc wifi network: You can connect to this network with your computer

Parameters:
SSID Name of the network to be created.
SSIDLength Lenght of the name.
key Security key.
keyLength Length of the security key.
Returns:
WIFI_OK if sucess, else error code.

Returns:
WIFI_OK if a packet is received else error code.

UInt8 JoinWifiNetwork ( UInt8 *  SSID,
UInt32  SSIDlength,
UInt8 *  key,
UInt32  keyLength,
UInt8  channel 
)

Join a wifi network.

Connect the robot to a wireless wifi network.

Parameters:
SSID Name of the network to be joined.
SSIDLength Length of the network's name.
key Security key.
keyLength Length of the security key.
channel Wifi channel number: 0 if unknown, else canal number.
Returns:
WIFI_OK if sucess, else error code.
UInt8 SendBufferToRemoteClient ( UInt8 *  buffer,
UInt32  size,
UInt8 *  ip,
UInt16  port 
)

Send a buffer to the TCP/IP network to a remote client.

The client must be connected to a server on the robot.

Parameters:
buffer Buffer to send.
size Size of buffer to send.
ip Must be 0 if you are sending to a tcp connection, else ip of the client.
port Must be 0 if you are sending to a tcp connection, else port of the client.
Returns:
WIFI_OK if packet is send, else error code.
UInt8 SendBufferToRemoteServer ( UInt8 *  buffer,
UInt32  size,
UInt8 *  ip,
UInt16  port 
)

Send a buffer to a remote server.

Parameters:
buffer Buffer to send.
size Size of buffer to send.
ip Must be 0 if you are sending to a TCP connection, else ip address of the server.
port Must be 0 if you are sending to a TCP connection, else port of the server.
Returns:
WIFI_OK if packet is send, else error code.
UInt8 SetIpConfiguration ( UInt8  dhcp,
UInt8 *  ip,
UInt8 *  subnet,
UInt8 *  gateway 
)

Set ip configuration of the wifi chip.

Parameters:
dhcp Set 1 to request an ip address from a dhcp server, else 0 to set your own ip configuration.
ip Ip address of the wifi module.
subnet Subnetwork mask.
gateway Ip address of the gateway for the wifi module.
Returns:
WIFI_OK if sucess, else error code.
